node.title: No airborne COVID-19 risk, ventilation problems in classrooms, says Queensland Education Minister
node.alt: An artist's rendition of what the COVID-19 particle looks like under microscope.
node.description: There is a vaccine mandate for all school workers, but it appears unlikely there will be a strategy for classroom ventilation â€” even as a teacher records CO2 levels more than four times the recommended level.
node.content:
["Queensland's Education Minister says there will not be a big ventilation problem in classrooms when school goes back next year.", "Grace Grace's remarks come despite the Victorian and New South Wales governments installing tens of thousands of air purifiers in classrooms\u00a0in addition to using carbon dioxide monitors to identify ventilation issues.\u00a0", "Concerns about COVID-19 transmission in classrooms have reignited amid an unknown timeline for when children under 12 will be eligible for the vaccine, and\u00a0expectations of widespread community transmission with open borders.\u00a0", "
Schools determine ventilation plans
", "The Queensland government this week issued a vaccine mandate for all staff in schools, kindergartens and childcare centres.\u00a0", "Ms Grace said guidelines on ventilation strategies would be released before December 17, when the state's border reopens.\u00a0", "", "
Queensland Education Minister Grace Grace said the issue of ventilation is being taken seriously.(ABC News: Lucas Hill)
", "Queensland Health said while they\u00a0had established ventilation standards for hotel quarantine facilities, given their nature, \"employers of other settings, including schools and offices, should determine ventilation plans based on the national advice and their specific circumstances\".", "It follows a Brisbane teacher recording CO2 levels \u2014 a proxy for ventilation \u2014 more than four times the recommended level, as revealed by ABC Radio Brisbane.\u00a0", "When asked if classroom ventilation was an issue that needed to be addressed, Ms Grace said she does not believe \"it's a big ventilation problem\".", "
Kidding ourselves that it's fine, air quality expert says
", "Atmospheric scientist Distinguished Professor Lidia Morawska said it is a problem.", "\"Unless we measure what the ventilation is\u00a0we don't know what the problem is, we don't where the problem is,\" she said.", "", "
Lidia Morawska pushed for authorities around the world to acknowledge the risk of airborne COVID-19 transmission.(ABC News: Emma Pollard)
", "Professor Morawska called for CO2 monitors to be used in full classrooms, either full-time or on a rotational basis, to determine the risks.", "Ms Grace said her department had established a working group covering state and non-government schools to examine ventilation strategies and advice from other states.", "\"It's had advice and we always follow the health advice from Queensland Health, Safe Work Australia, the World Health Organisation, the Doherty Institute, QUT, and we're also in close contact with actions taken in other states and territories,\" the Education Minister said.", "Based on that advice, Ms Grace said ventilation guidelines would be issued by December 17.", "
Divide over best practice for ventilation\u00a0
", "The Department of Education has said ventilation plans include opening windows and turning on fans, ensuring all air conditioners are maintained and serviced, and cleaning undertaking by trained staff.", "However, there are concerns that the government's installation of air conditioners has seen windows sealed shut and fans removed\u00a0which could prevent measures to improve natural air flow.", "Ms Grace said there was only 24 schools left to be \"fully air-conditioned\" of the Cooler Cleaner Schools program which \"have fresh air that come into the systems we've put in\".", "But Professor Morawska said air conditioners alone do not resolve ventilation issues, and without audits\u00a0simply relying on air-conditioning\u00a0or opening windows and using fans\u00a0does not prove there is safe ventilation.", "Ms Grace acknowledge the issue was taken seriously but highlight that \"we're not like New South Wales and Victoria\" with active cases in the community\u00a0\"so we've got time to work out what exactly is required\".", "A Queensland Health spokesperson said the department \"agrees that ventilation controls may be relevant in high-risk indoor environments such as schools, aged care residential facilities, dormitories, correctional facilities, and other workplaces\".", "The spokesperson said the department supports the advice of the Australian Health Protection Principal Committee (AHPPC) and Safe Work Australia about ventilation but it could not replace other prevention and control measures.", "", "
Dr Christian Rowan said parents have raised concerns about COVID-19 transmission in classrooms.\u00a0(Supplied: Twitter)
", "
Opposition calls for clarity
", "LNP education spokesman Dr Christian Rowan said parents and carers have raised genuine concerns over ventilation issues in their children's schools, but it has been two months of waiting.", "\"It is the Minister's responsibility to address these concerns now and give parents and carers the information and reassurance they need,\" he said.", "\"At no time before has it been more critical to provide clear and concise information than during this pandemic.\"", "", "
Heavily mutated Omicron variant puts scientist on alert
"]
